thread.title: Boys soccer: Montclair shuts out Livingston
thread.title_full: Boys soccer: Montclair shuts out Livingston

title: Boys soccer: Montclair shuts out Livingston
text:
Boys soccer: Montclair shuts out Livingston October 8, 2015 Last updated: Thursday, October 8, 2015, 12:31 AM The Montclair Times Print 
Quinn Baity and Ned Michalitsianos each scored a goal apiece to lift the Montclair High School boys soccer team to its fifth straight win Monday afternoon, defeating Super Essex Conference rival Livingston, 2-0. 
Ikem Mbalewe assisted both goals for the Mounties (7-2-1, 6-2-1 SEC-American), who recorded their sixth shutout of the year. Goalkeeper Phillip Martin made 1 save to earn the clean sheet. 
The Lancers had entered Monday’s game on a six-game unbeaten run, allowing one goal during that span. 
Last Wednesday, Sept. 30, Montclair also defeated Newark Academy, 2-1. Reece Bordick and Amani Marshall had the goals, while Martin made 3 saves. 
MHS hosted state power Seton Hall Prep Wednesday afternoon after The Times went to press, and will travel down the Shore to play Ocean Township this Saturday morning, Oct. 10. 
The recent hot streak should propel the Mounties to an expected top-four seed in the upcoming Essex County Tournament, which will be seeded this Tuesday, Oct. 13. The Round of 16, where Montclair will enter the fray, is scheduled for Wednesday, Oct. 21. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
